Articles.Content:
when i get into the game i launch a rocket, it works.

then when i exit the rocket/ plane to build another one i enter the spaceplane hangar and it crashes. this is the file error:

Unity Player [version: Unity 5.2.4f1_98095704e6fe]

KSP.exe caused an Access Violation (0xc0000005)
  in module KSP.exe at 001b:00e7a6ef.

Error occurred at 2016-10-01_014424.
C:\Program Files\Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\KSP.exe, run by Belinda.
77% memory in use.
3225 MB physical memory [719 MB free].
0 MB paging file [674 MB free].
2048 MB user address space [95 MB free].
Write to location 00000000 caused an access violation.

Context:
EDI:    0x00000000  ESI: 0x2a12b2d0  EAX:   0xcdcdcdcd
EBX:    0x01555558  ECX: 0x00555556  EDX:   0x00000000
EIP:    0x00e7a6ef  EBP: 0x14c3f944  SegCs: 0x0000001b
EFlags: 0x00010206  ESP: 0x14c3f924  SegSs: 0x00000023

Bytes at CS:EIP:
f3 ab 85 d2 74 0a 88 07 83 c7 01 83 ea 01 75 f6 

my system running is:

GPU= GEforce GTX 750

CPU= intel core i5-4460 CPU @ 320 ghz

operating system: windows 10 home edition

It looks like KSP tried to write to a null pointer, thus causing a segfault.

Have you tried deleting and re-installing KSP on your machine? Or, alternatively, tried starting a new save file? It could be a problem with your particular install, or with save file or .craft file corruption.

ty but i have reinstalled this game  many times with no results.

i have also found that it only crashes if over 70% memory is being used.

Okey, are you already playing in -openl or dx11?

Here some links how to force, I personaly prefer the dx11:

How to force opengl mode

How to force DirectX11: 40% Less memory use

On 03/10/2016 at 7:43 AM, DrLicor said:

Okey, are you already playing in -openl or dx11?

Here some links how to force, I personaly prefer the dx11:

How to force opengl mode

How to force DirectX11: 40% Less memory use

 

 

how do you change to dx11 with steam?

the forum How to force DirectX11: 40% Less memory use doesnt say how to do this with steam

Alright, go to your folder where ksp is installed. for steam users its normally: .../Program Files (x86)/Steam/steamapps/common/Kerbal Space Program

Make a shortcut for the KSP_x64.exe.

Rightclick on the shortcut, and follow the steps of the link I give you.
